titleInfo.title: THE EFFECT OF URBANIZATION ON SEMI-ARID VERSUS HUMID WATERSHEDS

mods.abstract: Flood increase factors were examined for 21 study basins in semi-arid and humid climate regions to determine whether the effects of urbanization on the magnitude of the mean annual flood varied with precipitation amount. Analysis of variance yielded marginally significant results when comparing flood increase factors for five precipitation groups. However, linear regression analysis indicated only 32 percent of the variation in flood factors could be explained by differences in precipitation. It was concluded that, although marginally significant differences were found between flood factors for the given precipitation groups, the difference was so slight that the results are inconclusive.
